wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Sir Charles James Briggs,  (22 October 1865 – 27 November 1941) was a British Army officer who held high command in World War I.

response: Alongside the medieval masonry, Briggs' alterations can still be seen today (albeit in ruins). Briggs' son, Colonel Charles James Briggs (father of Sir Charles James Briggs) inherited the castle in 1871 and built the nearby St Margaret's church (now demolished).
*1926–1940: Lt-Gen. Sir Charles James Briggs, KCB, KCMG
| XVI Corps || Lt-Gen. Charles James Briggs || 28th British Infantry Division & Greek Crete Division
